summary: Build an NFL Combine performance tracking app that lets a user record all combine-style drills in the latest NFL Combine format, track progress over time, and optionally broadcast/share results while comparing against official averages.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Modern athletic app logo with a football/combine stopwatch motif (combine-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Wide hero illustration of an athlete training for combine drills in a clean, modern graphic style (combine-hero.dim_1600x900.png)

existing_features.title: Add a guest mode so the app can be used immediately without requiring Internet Identity login; in guest mode, store Combine entries locally (per-browser) and clearly label the mode as "Guest (local only)" in the UI.

Implement a new Combine module that supports recording all standard NFL Combine drills and measurements in a "latest/official format" data entry flow, including at minimum: 40-yard dash (with split fields if provided), vertical jump, broad jump, bench press reps, 20-yard shuttle, 3-cone drill, and key measurements (height, weight, wingspan/arm length, hand size).
Add Combine history and progress views that list past entries and provide simple trend charts over time per drill/measurement (e.g., 40 time, vertical, bench reps).

Add comparison against official/typical NFL Combine benchmarks by displaying reference values next to each recorded drill (e.g., average/target ranges) and highlighting whether the user is above/near/below the reference.

Implement a broadcasting/sharing mode for Combine results: allow a user to generate a shareable "Combine Card" view for a selected entry and copy a share link; for signed-in users, support publishing a specific entry to a public list that is viewable without login.

Refocus the appâ€™s navigation and landing experience around the NFL Combine tracker (rename title/branding, update primary routes, and add navigation items for Combine: Dashboard, New Entry, History, Share/Published). Keep all user-facing text in English.

new_feature_requests.summary: Support recording all NFL Combine drills/stats in the newest/official Combine format (e.g., 40-yard dash, vertical, broad, bench reps, shuttle, 3-cone, measurements).
Progress tracking: save history and display charts/graphs over time for each drill/stat.
Comparison against official NFL Combine averages/benchmarks for context.
Broadcasting/sharing mode to publish or share recorded combine results ("recording mode and broadcasting").
Extend the Motoko backend actor to persist Combine entries per user and to store/read published (public) Combine entries needed for share links and a simple public feed.
If the backend uses stable state that requires upgrade support, update migration logic to initialize any new Combine-related storage while preserving existing stored data.

projectName: NFL Combine performance tracker with guest mode, drill logging, benchmarks, and shareable results
